snippets.snippet: Jiichiro Matsumoto established Kizakura as a branch family of the big sake brewery in Fushimi in 1925. The sake made in Misugura, one of the brewery in Kizakura build in 1964, has had been awarded the gold medal for 10 times since 2003. If you visit the Kizakura, you’ll notice a unique characters, called “Kappa”.

Inari is best known as the kami of rice, but Inari is also worshipped as the patron deity of business. The torii or vermillion gates lining the paths have been donated by businesses. Inari is also the kami of foxes, who are often represented as guardians of shrines.

snippets.snippet: Ramen (/ ˈ r ɑː m ə n /) (拉麺, ラーメン, rāmen, IPA: [ɾaꜜːmeɴ]) is a Japanese dish with a translation of "pulled noodles". It consists of Chinese wheat noodles served in a meat or (occasionally) fish-based broth, often flavored with soy sauce or miso, and uses toppings such as sliced pork (叉焼, chāshū), nori (dried seaweed), menma, and scallions.

snippets.snippet: Daigo-ji (醍醐寺, Daigo-ji) is a Shingon Buddhist temple in Fushimi-ku, Kyoto, Japan.Its main devotion is Yakushi.Daigo, literally "ghee", is used figuratively to mean "crème de la crème" and is a metaphor of the most profound part of Buddhist thoughts.

snippets.snippet: Der Daigo-ji ist eine wunderschöne Tempelanlage, die zum Flanieren und Verweilen einlädt. Selbstverständlich gibt es sehr viele, unfassbar schöne Anlagen in Japan und speziell in und um Kyoto, allerdings empfanden wir den Besuch des Daigo-ji als sehr angenehm, weil wir die ganze …

snippets.snippet: Right next to Fushimi Inari Shrine is Inafuku where they serve up sparrows and quails (Just like Nezameya). It does sound a bit... strange but there is a long history of this meal here and the taste is quite good. They are also known for their Inari-zushi, which is commonly eaten all over Japan, so if your hungry and need a bite to eat after of before visiting the shrine consider Inafuku.
snippets.title: Inafuku - Other Dining in Kyoto South Japan | SnapJapan.com

snippets.snippet: It was a wet Sunday morning when we visited Fushimi Inari Taisha in Kyoto on day 7 of our Japan trip. We spent less than 2 hours there and didn’t really explore much due to weather condition and gadget problem (2 persons sharing an umbrella is a no-no especially if you’re traveling). We had our lunch nearby the shrine in one of the many shops that serves kitsune udon called Inafuku 稲福.

snippets.snippet: Kyoto er en by i Japan, nær sørenden av Biwasjøen, 50 kilometer nordøst for Osaka som den har vokst sammen med. Byen har 1 475 183 innbyggere (2015). Kyoto ligger ved Tokaido-jernbanen mellom Tokyo og Osaka. Byen er et administrasjonssenter og senter for landets kunstindustri, særlig berømt for silkeveverier, porselen, lakkarbeider, sølv, emalje og så videre.
snippets.title: Kyoto – Store norske leksikon

snippets.snippet: Kyoto (japansk: 京都市; Kyōto-shi) er en by i prefekturet Kyoto i Japan.Tidligere var Kyoto hovedstad i Japan (794–1868) før den ble flyttet til Edo (nå Tokyo).I dag blir Kyoto ansett som Japans uoffisielle kulturhovedstad da 60 % av Japans kulturarv ligger i dette området.
snippets.title: Kyoto – Wikipedia

snippets.snippet: En is a small Japanese-style teahouse in the Gion area of Kyoto. You can enjoy an authentic tea ceremony experience first hand. Tea ceremony (the way of tea) is one of Japan's traditional cultural practices,

snippets.snippet: Kyoto has a humid subtropical climate (Köppen Cfa), featuring a marked seasonal variation in temperature and precipitation. Summers are hot and humid, but winters are relatively cold with occasional snowfall. Kyoto's rain season begins around the middle of June and lasts until the end of July, yielding to a hot and sunny latter half of the summer.
snippets.title: Kyoto - Wikipedia

snippets.snippet: Kyotoprotokollen er en internasjonal avtale om klimapolitikk. Den ble vedtatt i Kyoto, Japan, i desember 1997 som en protokoll til Klimakonvensjonen. Kyotoprotokollen inneholder et sett differensierte forpliktelser som totalt utgjør 5,2 % reduksjon i utslippene fra i-landene. Hovedreferanseåret for utslippsreduksjonene er 1990, og reduksjonene skulle ha vært gjennomført i perioden 2008–12.
snippets.title: Kyotoprotokollen – Store norske leksikon

snippets.snippet: Hva er Peter Pan-syndrom? En voksen som oppfører seg som et barn, er gøy i en liten stund. Man kan imidlertid bli lei av det. Det er ikke bare at vi må holde ut med deres vitser. En person med Peter Pan-syndrom ønsker ikke å vokse opp og modne, og de kommer aldri forbi den egosentriske, narsissistiske, umodne fasen av barndommen.

snippets.snippet: Kinshi Masamune’s “Tokiwa Well,” in the Fushimi district of Kyoto, produces more than 70 tons of natural spring water per hour. We completed our New Tokiwa Brewery here in 1995 with a new production system that is perfectly suited for brewing sake in the 21st century to produce the delicate aromatic flavor that is associated with Kyoto sake and which has long been celebrated by local chefs.
snippets.title: KINSHIMASAMUNE

snippets.snippet: For these, Kinshi Masamune uses a method that employs hanging cotton bags. The sake mash is placed into cotton bags that are hung so that the liquid is naturally pressed out by gravity. Natural pressing creates an elegant and mild taste.
snippets.title: KINSHIMASAMUNE

snippets.snippet: Kinshi Masamune was founded in 1781 in the ancient capitol of Kyoto. Eventually moving the brewing facilities to the Fushimi district for the favorable production conditions that exist there, we have been producing fine sake for more than 200 years and will continue to build upon our established traditions and techniques to bring the finest sake to generations to come.
snippets.title: KINSHIMASAMUNE

snippets.snippet: Matsuya Kyubei, the founder of Kinshi Masamune, established a sake brewery in Kyoto in 1781. The brewery facilities were moved to the Fushimi district of Kyoto in 1880, but the family residence and sake brewing tools are cultural resources that can still be seen in their original location in central Kyoto today.
snippets.title: Horino Memorial Museum - kinshimasamune.com

snippets.snippet: The “Tokiwa Well” is located on the grounds of the Kinshi Masamune Brewery and has been selected as one of the 100 most famous wells in Japan. Currently, the natural spring water gushes forth at a rate of 70 tons per hour, truly making it the “water of life” that sustains Kinshi Masamune sake.
snippets.title: KINSHIMASAMUNE

snippets.snippet: Kinshi Masamune, Horino Memorial Museum. ... Fushimi, but they left the remains of the brewery where it was and so it was opened as a museum in order to pass down Kyoto's sake culture. Kinshi Masamune is the company's name and is also a famous sake brand in Kyoto.
snippets.title: Kinshi Masamune, Horino Memorial Museum | Kyoto | Japan ...

snippets.snippet: Kyoto - Kinshi Masamune; In 1781, Kyubey Matsuya, the first-generation founder, was deeply involved in the history of classical Kyoto cuisine in the area south of the Imperial Palace. The SAKE is refined and bright, made using water from Kyoto, a place of scenic beauty.
